title: A pickup’s persistent plastic pan problems
author: John Paul
bullets: A 2018 Ford F-150 owner faces repeated problems with the truck's leaking plastic oil pan.
Ford offers a metal oil pan replacement, requiring 10 hours labor, versus five for replacing the plastic pan.
The Car Doctor recommends allowing the dealer to replace the part under warranty, citing potential design improvements.

title: Patriots get bad news with injuries ahead of Bucs matchup
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots' Kayshon Boutte and Rhamondre Stevenson missed Wednesday's practice due to hamstring and toe injuries, respectively.
Garrett Bradbury, New England's center, was also absent from practice, risking complications for the offensive line.
Tampa Bay's injury report includes notable absences of Chris Godwin and Bucky Irving, impacting their lineup before facing the Patriots.

title: Boston youth baseball coach pleads not guilty to drug trafficking charge
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Bryan Mejia, a coach at Boston Athletic Academy, charged with trafficking over 10 grams of fentanyl, pleads not guilty.
Mejia, 31, allegedly sold fentanyl to undercover Boston police on October 19, linked to unnamed trafficking organization.
Mejia released on personal recognizance; faces up to 20 years in prison if convicted, next court date December 1.

title: Education technology company to close Boston headquarters, embrace fully remote workplace
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Cengage Group will close its Boston, Detroit, and Cincinnati offices to adopt a fully remote work model.
The company, headquartered near Boston City Hall, operates digital products for 90 million students in 125 countries.
Cengage's only remaining U.S. location will be in Independence, Kentucky, as it shifts away from traditional offices.

title: What Patriots players did during their off day that impressed Mike Vrabel
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: 41 Patriots players voluntarily worked out on their day off at Gillette Stadium, impressing coach Mike Vrabel.
Tuesday is the only true rest day for Patriots players, with Monday focused on film review and treatment.
Stefon Diggs emphasized maintaining focus despite a 7-2 record, highlighting the need for continuous improvement.

title: Officials identify two killed in apparent murder-suicide in Beverly
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Becky Lynn Center, 58, and John Patrick Nesbitt, 56, found dead in Beverly home on Colonial Drive.
Officials describe the deaths as an apparent murder-suicide with both victims having gunshot wounds.
Beverly police, Massachusetts State Police, and the Chief Medical Examiner's Office are investigating the incident.

title: South Boston man linked to Bulger sentenced to 15 years for involvement in 1984, 1993 cold case killings
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Michael Lewis, linked to James 'Whitey' Bulger, sentenced to 15 years for two cold case killings in 1984 and 1993.
Lewis pleaded guilty to manslaughter for the deaths of Brian Watson and William Villani after initial first-degree murder charges.
A recording in 2020 captured Lewis admitting to the killings, leading to his indictment and subsequent plea deal.

title: Olney: Red Sox ‘well-positioned’ to try and trade for Tigers ace Tarik Skubal
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox are considering trading for Tigers ace Tarik Skubal, a potential 2026 Cy Young frontrunner, this offseason.
Skubal, 28, led the AL in ERA and WHIP in 2025, and will be a free agent after next season.
Boston has trade assets like Jarren Duran and young talents, plus financial capability to secure Skubal with a major contract.

title: Judge temporarily halts patron saint statues in Quincy, but PETA wants to help
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A judge temporarily halted the installation of two patron saint statues at Quincy's new public safety building.
PETA offered to help fund the statues if a third of St. Francis, patron of animals, is added.
The ACLU sued Quincy officials over religious concerns; a judge issued a preliminary injunction in October.

title: Bill Belichick commends Drake Maye for an ‘outstanding’ start with Patriots
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bill Belichick praised Patriots QB Drake Maye for an outstanding season, highlighting the dangers of a sophomore slump.
Drake Maye has led the Patriots to a 7-2 record, entering MVP conversations with strong passing and rushing stats.
Maye ranks fifth in passing yards and tied for third in touchdowns, with high completion rate and minimal interceptions.
